headline: Georgia Senate Candidate Herschel Walker Refuses To Resign From Presidential Council
author: Derek Saul
sentences:
Topline
Republican Senate candidate Herschel Walker said Thursday he won’t comply with President Joe Biden’s request that he resign from the President’s Council on Sports, Nutrition and Fitness, even though federal law dictates that the former football star step down from the role and the White House already named his replacement.

Key Facts
Walker, who was appointed to the council by President Donald Trump in 2018, tweeted Thursday, “I’m not a quitter so you are going to have to fire me.”
Walker asserted his ouster is because Biden is “scared” Walker will beat incumbent Sen. Raphael Warnock (D-Ga.) in November’s election.

The real reason for Walker’s exit is likely not so political: Members of federal advisory committees are deemed special government employees and the Hatch Act bars federal employees from seeking candidacy in partisan elections.
The controversial surgeon said Walker was “right” in his claim about the forced ouster’s political nature in a response tweet, and said Wednesday he also refuses to resign from the council.
Mehmet Oz, the talk show host turned Republican Senate candidate in Pennsylvania and a fellow Trump appointee to the presidential council, will also be removed due to his candidacy.
Biden intends to appoint WNBA star Elena Delle Donne and celebrity chef Jose Andrés as Oz and Walker’s replacements on the council, the White House announced Wednesday.
A Heisman Trophy Winner and former NFL All-Pro, Walker secured Trump’s endorsement last September and holds a narrow edge over Warnock in most polls.
